name: Hard Quiztory The First | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which 'American' was born in Scotland, became a Russian rear admiral, and had a dance named after him?
questions.explanation:
John Paul Jones.

	The famous naval officer was born in Kirkcudbright, Scotland in 1747.

questions.text: Which country was ruled by both Charles the Bald and Charles the Simple?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Charles the Bald was actually Charles I and Charles the Simple was Charles III.

Lord Louis Mountbatten.

	Lord Louis Mountbatten was the last viceroy of India.

questions.text: What was Che Guevara's original profession?
questions.explanation:
Doctor.

	Ernesto Guevara, was born in 1928 and died 1967. He was one of the twentieth centuries most influential rebel figures.

questions.text: Who rode a horse named Marengo?
questions.explanation:
Napoleon.

	This was also the name of a battle in the Napoleonic Wars in which Napoleon defeated the Austrians.

questions.text: What did Capt. Alcock and Lt. Brown achieve in 1919?
questions.correct: The first non-stop trans Atlantic flight
options: The first climb of the Eiger
The first descent into Mount Etna's crater.
The first north and south polar trek
questions.explanation:
The first non-stop trans Atlantic flight.

	Yes, it was done before Lindbergh, he was just the first one to do it solo.

questions.text: How many barrels of gunpowder did Guy Fawkes and his friends stash in the cellars of the Houses of Parliament?
questions.explanation:
About 30.

	What became known as the Gunpowder Plot gave us the English tradition of Fire Works Night(Guy Fawkes Night).

questions.text: What title was given to King Edward VIII after he abdicated?
questions.explanation:
Duke of Windsor.

	Edward married Wallis Simpson and they lived the rest of their lives as globe-trotters.

questions.text: What was Capability Brown famous for?
questions.explanation:
Landscape gardening.

	Lancelot Brown, 1715-1783, designed many famous English gardens including Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire and Chatsworth in Derbyshire.

questions.text: Which family of Spanish descent, that relocated to Italy during the late Renaissance, produced a Pope and a poisoner?
questions.explanation:
The Borgias.

	A true Renaissance family.
